subject: Re: Question
msgSnippet: I have only done small amounts of work with HTTPUnit, so my memory about how it worked is a little limited. In my answer, I will presume that you set the
messageBody:
I have only done small amounts of work with HTTPUnit, so my memory
about how it worked is a little limited.

In my answer, I will presume that you set the hidden element through
JavaScript (or similar) in the real environment. I would expect that
the value is set by some event, like a button click or another value
change. As I recall, HTTPUnit required that you follow the UI's path
to set this value, and simulate the button click, or other event.

I found this to be a pain, and a contradiction of the "Unit" of the title.

I hope this helps some.


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Maruthi Kusoji <maruthi_kn@y...> wrote:
>
> I didn't get your problem exactly, though i thought following thing
would help you.
> If temp_phone is a hidden element. then
>
> form.temp_phone.value = '123456'
> this.form.submit()
>

> David Saff
